page.title: 03THE RIVER SWIFT-UPTON
page.content: {The River Swift}is really a winter bourne. It starts flowing about January and has usually stopped by June. There are two sources for the bourne, one near Hen Barn at {Upton}, and the other at Cock Pit in the {Netherton valley. There is a local saying "When the Cock and Hen shall meet, corn will be dear and hay cheap". The 'Cock' and 'Hen' meet in Church Street on the bend near Parsonage Farm in{Hurstbourne Tarrant.}The 'Hen' flows down the valley from {Upton}, and even in the summer you can see the dry river bed. The'Cock' goes underground in { {Netherton}valley and flows inside a pipe through the village until it. reaches the 'Hen' in Church Street.You can see the pipe where it emerges.
